scenario:
Amazon ended 2024 up 44% in 52 weeks and is poised to leverage its e-commerce platform to gain market share and harness the power of artificial intelligence (AI) to supercharge its cloud platform. Key areas of focus include:

- E-commerce: Amazon has gained market share, surpassing 40% of total U.S. e-commerce sales in 2024, and is improving logistics networks and adding products to ensure Prime customers rely on it for everyday essentials. Same-day orders increased 25% year over year in the third quarter, and a new warehouse model in Louisiana is cutting processing time by 25%.

- Cloud computing and AI: Amazon Web Services (AWS) accounts for 31% of the total global cloud market and has seen sales growth accelerate to 19% year over year in the third quarter. AWS has developed a powerful AI business with tools for developers, midsize enterprises, and small business clients, and CEO Andy Jassy believes it has massive long-term potential.

- Streaming: Amazon owns MGM Studios and has the rights to Thursday Night Football, and has rolled out an ad-supported tier combined with a robust advertising business to generate new opportunities.

- Ad business: Amazon's ad business has been its fastest-growing operation, with access to hundreds of millions of Prime members and a data-rich, AI-based system giving advertisers the tools to succeed.

- Acquisitions and investments: Amazon has acquired AI company Anthropic and is investing in healthcare and its pharmacy business, with a focus on growing the AI business.

Amazon stock has beaten the market in 2024 and is well-positioned to do it again this year, with incredible growth prospects and less risk. It is expected to amply reward investors over the next five years.
